Key Match Events: Jose Altuve stole home to secure a first run and afford Arrighetti, Houston's rookie starter, a lead.
Yordan Alvarez hit three home runs, his first three-homer game since 2022.
Pre-Game Insights: The Astros noticed certain tendencies the Philadelphia Phillies demonstrated on pickoff throws and put it in the heads of their base runners.
The Astros' margin for error is minuscule, the byproduct of a beaten-up roster and this strenuous schedule against the sort of teams they hope to encounter in October.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Joe Espada said, 'That's the offense I expect our boys to be every day.'
Alex Bregman supplied two hits of his own, and Espada said, 'That's the offense I expect our boys to be every day.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Astros have scored first in 69 of their 133 games, and Wednesday's 10-0 victory was their 49th win when doing so.
The Astros are already in a six-man rotation, meaning Arrighetti will receive an extra day of rest before his next start.
Others: The game was played in 96-degree Philadelphia heat, and the Astros took advantage of Taijuan Walker's poor throw to score their first run.
The Astros' next challenge is a four-game series against the Kansas City Royals at home.
